item.title: Skin Effect
item.description: Description AC Current tends to travel on the outer surface of a conductor. This effect increases with the AC frequency (the skin depth decreases as frequency increases.

item.title: Pressure Transducer
item.description: Background Measures pressure. Some common designs use a flexible diaphram, strain gauge, capacitance, or piezoelectric sensors to convert a pressure into an electrical signal.

item.description: Measurement circuits Measuring the output from various [[notes/electrical/sensors/Sensors|Sensors]] Transducer Measurement Techniques Excitation In line with Measurement ![[notes/electrical/concepts/images/SimpleTransducerExcitation.png]] Transmitter Connection Types !

item.title: LV Dictionary
item.description: Some notes about random [[notes/software/labview/LabVIEW|LabVIEW]] concepts Channel Wires can be used to visually understand sending objects through wires channels are dynamically created when loaded, and then compiled.

item.title: Sensors
item.description: A reference on sensor types. The measurement of various sensors may involve an external circuit, see [[notes/electrical/concepts/Circuits|Circuits]]. Temperature Thermocouple Pyrometer RTD (Resistance Temperature Detector) Pressure Altimeter barometer [[notes/electrical/sensors/Pressure Transducer|Pressure Transducer]]] Radiation GeigerMullerTube

item.title: Design Patterns
item.description: Decorator adds ability to dynamically add functionality and behavior to an object without affecting the behavior of other existing objects within the same class

item.title: Digital Logic
item.description: Gray Code A variation of binary code in which consecutive values are only different by one bit. Used in applications where minimal switching is required.

item.title: LabVIEW Style Notes
item.description: Reasons to care about style: helps other programmers understand your code more quickly helps “you” understand your own code in X months when you come back to it helps with debugging makes it easier to add changes or features later helps you stay consistent Linked to [[notes/software/labview/LVTips|LVTips]] Icons Background [[notes/software/labview/LabVIEW|LabVIEW]] icons are layered.

item.title: LVDT
item.description: Linear Variable Differential Transformer , also known as Linear Variable Displacement Transducer , and also differential transformer. Description A transformer that measures linear position.

item.title: Eddy Current
item.description: Description Loops of electric current induced in a conductor by a changing magnetic field per Faraday’s law of induction. Eddy currents flow in closed loops perpendicular to the magnetic field.

item.title: Electrical Concepts
item.description: A dictionary of acronyms to know/understand in the EE world, as I think of them ADC - analog to digital converter aka digitizer.

item.title: Software Terms
item.description: Terms Development Lint/Linting - a static code analysis tool used to find programming or syntax errors, bugs, suspicious code. For example, if coding in Python in Visual Studio Code, you can download a python lint extension that finds bugs as you develop.

item.title: TOML

item.title: Transducer
item.description: summary An electronic device that converts energy from one form to another. For example, heat into voltage. Sound into frequency.

item.title: Journey of Discovery
item.description: it’s a journey This is a list of things I’m curious about or am learning about. I had a coworker who used to joke that when something at work ended up being a much more complicated task than originally planned, we had to take a “journey of discovery” to fix it.

item.title: Native Butterfly Garden
item.description: Background It has been on my mind lately to create a little walking path/garden with native plants for pollinators. I’d love to attract butterflies, hummingbirds, and bees!

item.title: Python UIs
item.description: Some considerations a python ui might not be displayed on a typical windows desktop as we might be most used to Some packages dearpygui Qt (Pyside/PyQt) pip install pyqt6

item.title: Portrait Notes
item.description: Some notes about taking photos for a portrait session Portrait Basics Poses Looking up at the photographer is more flattering in general Looking towards light helps brighten eyes if that is important have a list of poses ready before the session but be ready to improvise Light golden hour (the hour before sunset) direction and amount of light can change the tone light in front of subject unless you want a silhouette Backdrops background can be distracting, use plain backdrops if not using a picturesque location indoors Kids Camera Settings More like sports photography than still.

item.title: Blender
item.description: Extruding a Logo Import an SVG that is in vector format (see [[notes/software/inkscape/Inkscape Basics|Inkscape Basics]]) Select all paths In the Object Data Properties menu, go to Geometry->Extrude !

item.title: Stable Diffusion
item.description: Background A text to image diffusion model. “AI generated art” Samples prompt: “flying yellow piper airplane sunset” The tri-wing is an interesting concept…How to get off the ground though?

item.description: The Heart and the Sky I feel a camaraderie with anyone who has flown and I know it is a common feeling in the flying community.

item.title: Traffic Pattern

item.title: SDR
item.description: “Software Defined Radio” A software-tunable [[notes/electrical/RF/RF|RF]] device. Working Principle Replacement of analog modulator, demodulator, tuner with ADC (analog to digital converter) and DSP (digital signal processing)

item.title: altimeter
item.description: Description Ambient air enters the device into the back panel from the outside static port. Inside the altimeter is a bellows (aneroid) which expands or contracts based on the air pressure inside.

item.title: barometric
item.description: Piezo-resistive type Differences in pressure result in a changing resistance due to distortion

item.title: Pitot-Static System
item.description: Ambient air pressure for the pitot and static pressure are supplied through the pitot head on the bottom of the left wing of the [[notes/aviation/club/Archer Specs|Piper Archer]] This is part of the complete airspeed, Altimeter and VSI system.

item.title: Pyrometer
item.description: Also referred to as infared thermometer radiation thermometer non-contact thermometer Measures radiation from an object at a distance in order to determine the object’s temperature.

item.title: Thermocouple
item.description: Measures temperature using the Seebeck Effect. Essentially when two materials are joined and there is a temperature difference between the two materials, a small amount of current will flow.

item.title: Transponder
item.description: Background Short for “transmitter responder” Identification of Friend or Foe (IFF) A basic command/reply response system for identification and classification of aircraft in a controlled airspace

item.title: Geiger
item.description: Background A geiger counter detects radioactive particles. Essentially, a high voltage potential is connected to a thin metal wire (anode) suspended in a vaccuum tube where the metal tube itself (cathode) is connected to ground.

item.title: GeigerCounter
item.description: The plan Use a common device like the Geiger Muller Tube to detect free electrons resulting from the decay of a nearby radioactive material.

item.title: PancakeDetector
item.description: Background Variation of a GeigerMullerTube. May be referred to as a G-M counter. Measures approx 2 in across and 1/2 inch thick.

item.title: QRNG
item.description: Background Wouldn’t it be fun to make my own QuantumComputing random number generator? Possible Solutions Use a radioactive source, a splitter, and two GeigerCounters Use a laser source, a 50/50 beam splitter, and photoresistors https://turbofuture.

item.title: QuantumComputing
item.description: Background A photon is considered both a wave and a particle. When a photon is observed it behaves like a particle.

Summary A lithium ion rechargeable battery Li-ION “A cell” Nominal voltage 3.7V There are protected cells and unprotected. Protected cells include a circuit that prevents overcharging (and fires, etc) !

item.title: BatteryPacks
item.description: Background The massage gun is broken. Let’s learn about Li-ION and fix it. Step 1 Took it apart. Yes, the handle contains a pack of 6x 18650 lithium ion batteries in series to create about 24 volts.

item.title: Electrokinetic Propulsion
item.description: Asymmetric Capacitor Force on an asymmetric capacitor http://jnaudin.free.fr/lifters/arl_fac/index.html The Lifter http://jnaudin.free.fr/lifters/main.htm Biefeld-Brown Effect Thomas Townsend Brown discovered that if he charged a capacitor with high voltage direct current, the capacitor would exhibit thrust in the direction of the + positive electrode.

item.title: Smart Grid Concepts
item.description: https://www.digikey.com/en/articles/power-modules-underpin-smart-grid-adoption Phasor Measurement Units (PMUs) that allow operators to assess grid stability, advanced digital meters that give consumers better information and automatically report outages, relays that sense and recover from faults in substations automatically, automated feeder switches that re-route power around problems, and batteries that store excess energy and make it available to the grid later to meet customer demand.

item.title: Smart Grid Links
item.description: Summary A smart grid is an electricity network that uses digital and other advanced technologies to monitor and manage the transport of electricity from all generation sources to meet the varying electricity demands of end users.

item.title: RT Notes
item.description: Concepts Timed loops Iteration Duration - how long it took previous iteration of loop to run Finished Late? - Bool that is true if timed loop did not execute within required period If using timed loops, keep the VI priority to normal

item.title: About Digital Gardens
item.description: I love gardening, and I love electrons. Here you will find a combination of both. This is my space to put ideas out “into the void” and capture the links between subjects and ideas as they evolve.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! I’m Laura. This is my personal wiki/ digital garden 🐛 using Quartz and Obsidian. I’m a two time electrical engineer (BSEE and MSEE) and a LabVIEW developer.

item.title: ADS-B Basics
item.description: Description Newly required circa 2020. Replaces and/or supplements Mode A/C/S Transponder. How airplane systems communicate important data such as position, speed, altitude, and type to ground stations and other aircraft.

item.description: The four forces of flight: Lift, Weight, Thrust, and Drag Lift: a decrease in air pressure on the top surface of a wing, a combination of Bernoulli’s prinicple and Newton’s third law

item.description: An index of topics correlated with airplanes, my love of aviation, and some related tech that I find interesting. item.title: RTL-SDR Antennna Design
item.description: Summary Antenna dimension (wavelength) inversely correlated with target frequencies. Higher frequencies can be received with shorter antenna length. Lower frequencies require long antennas.

item.title: RTL-SDR Basics
item.description: Background A software defined radio SDR device with USB connectivity and a large user base with lots of projects and open source software available.

item.title: Setting up a new RTL-SDR Device
item.description: #rtlsdr #adsb #sdr RTL-SDR Setup Download sdr# install-rtlsdr.bat from sdrsharp zip plug in RTL-SDR dongle run zadig.exe select Interface0 ( may need to go to Options-> List All Devices) run SDRSharp.

item.title: Silicon Wafer
item.description: Description Thin slices of silicon used in the production of integrated circuits or for solar cells. The wafer serves as a substrate for microelectronic devices built in and on the wafer.

item.title: WeatherStation
item.description: The train derailment in East Palestine, OH and subsequent lack of communication to local residents had me researching whether there are reliable environmental monitors out there that everyday citizens can use and share for themselves.
